intro: Dayaoshania cotinifolia, commonly known as the Chinese elderberry, is a shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, dark purple berries that ripen in the fall. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, white flowers in clusters. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and traditional medicinal uses. The berries are used in local remedies and are also a source of natural pigments.
